Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Settings represents the current settings at a given time.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nikolaj Ignatieff Schwartzbach

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Performs a deep copy of the specified Settings object.
      Settings(java.lang.String s)
      Instantiates a Settings object based on its string representation.
      Settings(java.lang.String[] str)
      Instantiates a Settings object based on a list of strings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        public Settings()
        Instantiates a Settings object with the default values.

      • Settings

        public Settings(boolean[] activePlayers,
                int tollSize,
                int robRisk,
                int minLoss,
                int maxLoss,
                int gameSpeed)
        Instantiates a new Settings object based on its values.
        Parameters:
        activePlayers - Which players are active. Must be an array of length 3, where each index corresponds to a given player (0 = random, 1 = greedy, 2 = smart).
        tollSize - The toll size (in %).
        robRisk - The risk of robbery (in %).
        minLoss - The minimum loss when robbed (in €).
        maxLoss - The maximum loss when robbed (in €).
        gameSpeed - The game speed. Must be in the interval [0,4], where 0 = stop, and 4 = sonic.

      • Settings

        public Settings(Settings s)
        Performs a deep copy of the specified Settings object.
        Parameters:
        s - The Settings to copy.

      • Settings

        public Settings(java.lang.String s)
         throws SettingsException
        Instantiates a Settings object based on its string representation.
        Parameters:
        s - The string representation of this Settings object.
        Throws:
        SettingsException

      • Settings

        public Settings(java.lang.String[] str)
         throws SettingsException
        Instantiates a Settings object based on a list of strings. The first line is the active players, the second line is tollSize, and so on.
        Parameters:
        str - An array of string representations of the settings.
        Throws:
        SettingsException

    • Method Detail

      • getGameSpeed

        public int getGameSpeed()
        Gets the current game speed: 0: STOP 1: SLOW 2: MED 3: FAST 4: SONIC
        Returns:
        An integer in the interval [0,4] representing the current game speed.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive(int player)
        Determines whether or not a given AI player is currently active.
        Parameters:
        player - The AI Player to test (0 = random, 1 = greedy, 2 = smart).
        Returns:
        A boolean representing whether or not the given player is active.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(int player,
                      boolean active)
        Sets whether or not a given AI Player is active.
        Parameters:
        player - The AI Player to change activity of (0 = random, 1 = greedy, 2 = smart).
        active - Whether or not this player should be active.

      • setGameSpeed

        public void setGameSpeed(int gameSpeed)
        Sets the current game speed: 0: STOP 1: SLOW 2: MED 3: FAST 4: SONIC
        Parameters:
        gameSpeed - An integer in the interval [0,4] representing the current game speed.

      • setMinMaxRobbery

        public void setMinMaxRobbery(int min,
                             int max)
        Changes the bounds for robbery.
        Parameters:
        min - The new minimum robbery amount (in €).
        max - The new maximum robbery amount (in €).
